item.title: What do you need to do/know as a blockchain engineer?
item.description:
What do you need to do/know as a blockchain engineer?

When my dad turned 16, he wanted a motorbike. His father said that if he could afford to run a motorbike, he could afford to pay rent. My father couldn't afford both, so he got the motorbike but kept it at a friend's house.

item.title: How Blockchain Could Help Refugees with Proof of Identity
item.description:
How Blockchain Could Help Refugees with Proof of Identity

Blockchain technology may help refugees maintain legal identity and have access to relief services when they cross borders, according to Staci Warden, executive director of the Center for Financial Markets at the Milken Institute, writing in The Wall Street Journal. Refugees often have their IDs confiscated when they leave their country of origin.

item.title: Stampery Announces More Powerful API And New Interface
item.description:
Stampery Announces More Powerful API And New Interface

Anchoring data to the Bitcoin blockchain is an emerging trend these days. Stampery is one o the companies active in this space, and they have launched a new API for industrial users. Moreover, the certification service has been improved, allowing for a faster and slicker user experience.

item.title: Survey: UK Companies Buy Bitcoin to Pay off Ransomware Extortionists
item.description:
Survey: UK Companies Buy Bitcoin to Pay off Ransomware Extortionists

A recent survey by corporate networking firm Citrix has revealed that companies are 'stockpiling' bitcoin to use the cryptocurrency as ransom payment if faced with a ransomware attack. Over the years, cybercriminals have conducted phishing campaigns, hacking endeavors and DDoS attacks as effective means to engage in cybercrime.

item.title: Payment Terminal Botnet Collected over 1.2 million Card Details Since April
item.description:
Payment Terminal Botnet Collected over 1.2 million Card Details Since April

Credit card fraud is still on the rise, despite countermeasures by card issuers and banks. As it turns out, there is a growing point-of-sale botnet in the United States, linking hacked payment terminals together. This allows hackers to monitor credit card information in real-time and abuse any information passing through these terminals.

item.title: Hacker Sells Twitter Data Dump On Deep Web For 10 Bitcoin
item.description:
Hacker Sells Twitter Data Dump On Deep Web For 10 Bitcoin

Data breaches remain a lucrative business for Internet criminals, especially when they want to sell information for Bitcoin. A data dump containing over 33 million hacked Twitter accounts are now up for grabs in exchange for 10 Bitcoin.

item.title: Counterparty: The Fuel for Bitcoin Price Stability?
item.description:
Counterparty: The Fuel for Bitcoin Price Stability?

Bitcoin has managed to move one step further up the financial stairway, reaching $581 USD as of press time. While the jump isn't as large as its predecessor, the price of bitcoin hasn't been this strong in well over a year, and many are breathing a long sigh of relief and hoping things continue to stay this way.

item.title: Decentralized social media platform Steemit grows by 1,600% in first month
item.description:
Decentralized social media platform Steemit grows by 1,600% in first month

Within the first month of its launch, Steemit, a decentralized social media site that rewards content creators with cryptocurrency, experienced a 1,600 percent increase in community size. In a pres...

item.title: Hong Kong Regulator Thinks Blockchain Can Curb Money Laundering
item.description:
Hong Kong Regulator Thinks Blockchain Can Curb Money Laundering

The Hong Kong Regulator has mentioned that the blockchain technology can be used to ensure proper implementation of AML and KYC regulations by the banks. Read more... Bitcoin and Bitcoin technology are like two sides of the same coin. While Bitcoin is clearly not a favorite among banks and financial institutions, its underlying Blockchain technology receives a much favorable treatment.

item.title: How could blockchain make financial crises less damaging?
item.description:
How could blockchain make financial crises less damaging?
